Project Description: ADANI VIZHINJAM PORT PVT. LTD., (AVPPL) has obtained the Environmental Clearance (1416/EC1/2019/SEIAA) from SEIAA for Granite Building Stone over an extent of 1.1081 Hectares, located in Block No.-29, Re-Survey No. 120/10 (Govt. Land) at Manickal Village of Nedumangad Taluk, Thiruvananthapuram District, Kerala quarry with a production not exceeding 70,230 MT for six years. AVPPL planned to produce 70,230 MT during the year 2021-2022 assuming that the approval of Quarrying Lease may be obtained by 2020 but, got the Quarrying Lease by March 2022 due to Covid -19. AVPPL need more boulders to complete the breakwater construction within stipulated time by May 2023 and start the port operation by July 2023. So, AVPPL divided the total mineable reserves for two years instead of 5 years in the Modified Mining Plan.In this context, a fresh application is made for modification in EC.
Organization Name: MS ADANI VIZHINJAM PORT PRIVATE LIMITED
Project Name: M/s. Adani Vizhinjam Port Private Limited

Project Description:
The project of Jal Jeevan Mission is aimed for providing portable drinking water to the entire area of Chakkupallam, Vandanmedu, Karunapuram and Vandiperiyar Panchayaths in Udumbanchola and Peerumedu Taluk in Idukki District of Kerala.
The scheme area is situated at south eastern part of Idukki district of Kerala. These panchayaths are surrounded Kumily at north, Theni District of State of Tamilnadu at east, Kattappana at south Peerumedu at west. The area is socially and economically in fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as higher living standards has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extend. The area being draught affected and inadequacy of existing water supply schemes has created acute water scarcity during summer. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayats.
Project Name: Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)-JJM : WSS TO CHAKKUPALLAM, VANDANMEDU, KARUNAPURAM AND VANDIPERIYAR PANCHAYATS IN IDUKKI DISTRICT
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street:
Office of the Executive Engineer
Kerala Water Authority
Project Division Kattapana

Project Description:
It has been noted that the people of Pinarayi and Eranholi panchayat have been silently
suffering from the adverse impact of ingress of brackish water to the upstream of
Ummenchira river causing shortage of fresh water for drinking and for cultivation during
summer months. This area has acute drinking water problem as all the surrounding water
bodies have been affected by brackish water. Hence the primary purpose of the RCB is to
block entry of brackish water into the upper reaches of Ummenchira river and to provide
additional two lane Bridge to form part of the proposed widening of the Thalassery
Mattannur road connectivity to Kannur airport via Ancharakandy.
Last Visible Status: Pending at UA for CA Payment and Compliance Report
Organization Name: KERALA IRRIGATION INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION LIMITED
Project Name: KIIFB- CONSTRUCTION OF REGULATOR CUM BRIDGE ACROSS UMMENCHIRA RIVER AT CHEKKUPALAM IN PINARAYI GRAMAPANCHAYATH IN KANNUR DISTRICT
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: Kerala Irrigation Infrastructure Development Corporation Ltd
Organization Legal Status: State PSU (eg. State Forest Corp., TANGEDCO, Mineral development Corp)

Project Description:
The Project named “JJM WSS TO Munnar GP Rajamal – Pettimudi zone” is aimed for providing potable drinking water to the Rajamala and Pettimudi areas of Munnar Panchayath in Idukki  District of Kerala. 

		These Panchayaths lack of reliable water supply schemes has led to an acute water scarcity. Hence it is very necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayaths. The areas being drought affected during summer season worsen the situation further. Hence new schemes are proposed to meet the water demand at a rate of 100lpcd in rural areas for a design period of 30 years from 2023. All the schemes are sourced from Idukki reservoir to meet the estimated water demand throughout the year because no any other sustainable water source available at proposed areas.
Project Name: JJM WSS TO Munnar GP Rajamal – Pettimudi zone
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

The project is proposed by M/s Galaxy Rocks (represented by its Managing Partner Mr. Shemeel R), Kummil P.O, Kottarakkara, Kollam, Kerala. Main rock type in the lease area is Garnateferrous Biotite Gneiss of the Khondalite suite. The project is proposed for extraction of Khondalite for Granite building stone. The applicant intends to produce an average of around 1,00,000 MT (1st year), 2,00,000 MT (from 2nd to 5th year) and 1,62,500 MT (from 6th to 12th year) through open cast mechanized method of mining with bench system. Project Description:
The project of Jal Jeevan Mission is aimed for providing portable drinking water to the entire area of Chakkupallam, Vandanmedu, Karunapuram and Vandiperiyar Panchayaths in Udumbanchola and Peerumedu Taluk in Idukki District of Kerala.
The scheme area is situated at south eastern part of Idukki district of Kerala. These panchayaths are surrounded Kumily at north, Theni District of State of Tamilnadu at east, Kattappana at south Peerumedu at west. The area is socially and economically in fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as higher living standards has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extend. The area being draught affected and inadequacy of existing water supply schemes has created acute water scarcity during summer. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayats.

Project Description: The project envisages pumping water from the Periyar River,near the Pumphouse of water authority at Avolichal to Perakuthu thodu during summer months. It will be very helpful to the farmers along the sides of Perakuthu thodu to enhance the irrigation potential. Pipe line has to be laid along PWD road side and also through forest land. No alternate route is available for laying pipe.This is our third submission for getting forest sanction.Fist proposal SW/245251/2021 was submitted on 16/12/2021and join inspection was conducted with DFO. Due to overlapping of pipeline alignment with Hill highway alignment ,DFO directed to resubmit the proposal again.As per the direction a new propoasl SW/102020/2022 was submitted on 16/09/2022.As there is a mismatch in the area entered in the proposal SW/102020/2022 and due to updation going in the Parivesh portal, Draft proposal was submitted to DFO .Now from satellite office, Kannur via phone call (23/01/2023) informed to resubmit the application again

Project Description:
Residential Apartments G+16 floors in Survey No. 200/1, 200/3, 200/6, 1503, 1576, 1577 of Edakochi Village, Kochi Municipal Corporation, Ernakulam District, comprises 39 residential units, falls in CRZ II as per CRZ Notifications. The project obtained a building permit (SYP1/549/09 received on 17.09.2009), and Integrated Consent to Operate from KSPCB.
Based on the CRZ Notification (Amendment) for post facto project clearance dated 06/03/2018, we submitted application on 09.06.2018 to the MoEF&CC within the stipulated window period.
The Hon’ble High Court of Kerala, in WP(C) 1325/2014, delivered the final judgement on 11.02.2022, directing KCZMA and MoEFCC to consider proposal and pass the final order regarding the post facto CRZ clearance. KCZMA, in its 123rd meeting (1047/A1/2017/KCZMA, 22.07.2022), recommended the project for CRZ clearance and forwarded it to MoEF&CC. Subsequently, 327th meeting of EAC(MoEFCC) considered the proposal.
Project Name: CHAKOLAS LAKESIDE
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: residential apartment construction in own property

Project Description:
‘Avigna Warehouse/Logistics Park’ developed by Avigna Jeya Pvt. Ltd., Avigna Parks Pvt. Ltd. & Avigna Irra Pvt. Ltd. is located at Parakkadavu Village, Aluva Taluk, Ernakulam District, Kerala. The project consists of 4 warehouse buildings along with necessary amenities like 3 security rooms, utility building, drivers rest room and scrap yard. The total built-up area of the project is 51,534.58 sq.m and is proposed to be constructed phase-wise in a plot area of 86,425 sq.m.
The construction of the phase 1 of the project, that is the construction of ‘Warehouse 3’ along with the amenity units, having a total built-up area of 11,808.82 sq.m is in progress. As the built-up area of phase 1 is below the threshold built-up area of 20,000 sq.m as per EIA Notification 2006, EC was not acquired for the same. The phase 2 is the construction of Warehouses 1, 2 and 4, having a total built-up area of 39,725.76 sq.m. We are applying for prior EC for phase 2 as per EIA Notification 2006.
Project Name: ‘Avigna Warehouse/Logistics Park’ at Parakkadavu, Ernakulam.
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The project site has close proximity to NH 544: Salem - Kochi Highway (2.6 km E), Karukutty railway station (3.9 km E), Cochin International Airport (12.6 km SE) and Cochin Port (45.7 km SW). Thus forms an ideal location for establishing a warehouse project which will house finished goods. There is an existing well and borewell available at the site as water sources. The plot does not fall in a flood or landslide-prone area.

Project Description: The proposed development is for Construction of a Cable Stayed/Suspension Bridge across Ponnani estuary with Approaches. The project is part of the Coastal Highway wherein the proposed alignment will be linking the two points on southern side the Ponnani Junction (NH 66 Bypass) and Northern side Padinjarekkara-Kuttayi Road. The project corridor starts at the Ponnani Junction (between Palakkad-Ponnani Road and Panvel-Kochi-Kanyakumari Highway of NH-66) and ends at Padinjarekara beach after crossing the Bharathapuzha River.Total length of proposed development corridor, including the bridge structure, is ~ 4.80 kms. The bridge structure is planned across mouth of Bharathapuzha River where the river meets Arabian Sea in Ponnani.
Organization Name: ROADS AND BRIDGES DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION OF KERALA LTD
Project Name: Proposed “Construction of Cable Stayed/Suspension Bridge across Ponnani Estuary with approaches"
Alternative Site Examined: YES

Project Description:
Al-Azhar Medical College and Super Speciality Hospital was established in the year 2014 at Kumaramangalam Village, Thodupuzha Taluk, Idukki District, Kerala State with a Hospital Block facilitated with 300 no. of beds, College Block, Boys Hostel, Girls Hostel and Staff Quarters within the plot area of 1,12,521 m2 owned by the hospital management. Presently there is an intake of 150 seats per year for MBBS.
The construction started in the year 2012. The EIA Notification 2006 was violated in the period of 2015-2016 when the threshold of 20,000 m2 for EC was crossed by the vertical expansion of Hospital Block upgraded with 350 additional beds. The built-up area in excess of 20,000 m2 is 13,819.69 m2 (excluding the built-up area of educational buildings).  The proponent has been completed the construction of 56,881.81 m2 including educational buildings in the year 2018. However, the construction of hospital building was stopped in 2016.
Organization Name: AL-AZHAR MEDICAL COLLEGE AND SUPER SPECIALITY HOSPITAL
Project Name: Al-Azhar Medical College and Super Speciality Hospital

Project Description:
The Project named “JJM WSS TO Munnar GP Rajamal – Pettimudi zone” is aimed for providing potable drinking water to the Rajamala and Pettimudi areas of Munnar Panchayath in Idukki  District of Kerala. 

		These Panchayaths lack of reliable water supply schemes has led to an acute water scarcity. Hence it is very necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayaths. The areas being drought affected during summer season worsen the situation further. Hence new schemes are proposed to meet the water demand at a rate of 100lpcd in rural areas for a design period of 30 years from 2023. All the schemes are sourced from Idukki reservoir to meet the estimated water demand throughout the year because no any other sustainable water source available at proposed areas.
Project Name: JJM WSS TO Munnar GP Rajamal – Pettimudi zone
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street:
Office of the Executive Engineer
Kerala Water Authority
Project Division Kattapana

Project Description: Under the jurisdiction of Elecaical Division, Pathanamthiaa 5 nos.of applications have been obtained for LT service connection in together from Maniyar area. Upon inspection, it is observed that 11 kV HT UG cable is to be drawn through the forest area at Maniyar for providing the LT supply at applicants premises. These premises are located at Inchapoika in village Veliyanadu which is surrounded by forest from all  sides. There is no access to electricity. Supply to this area can be extended from Maruthimoodu Depot area by drawing 500metres of high Tension UG cable through forest land and erecting a transformer in the private land at Inchapoika and further electricity distribution to the premises is using Low Tension UG cables considering the high exposure to wildlife in the area. The land to be diverted for laying the UG cables in the forest land is approximately 500mx0.45m=0.0225 hectares. The work will in no way interfere with the forest or wildlife activities.
Last Visible Status: Pending at UA due to EDS by DFO

Project Description: The Project Named “JJM – WSS TO DEVIKULAM-CHINNAKANAL  PANCHAYATH IN IDUKKI DISTRICT”  is aimed for providing potable drinking water to the entire area of Devikulam and Chinnakanal Panchayaths in Idukki District of Kerala State. The scheme area is situated at the south North western part of Idukki district of Kerala. These areas are socially and economically in a fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as the higher living standard has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extent. The area is drought affected and acute water scarcity is being faced during summer. The existing water supply schemes to these areas are inadequate. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayats. It is proposed to include the water demand of this panchayat in the comprehensive scheme.
Project Name: JJM – WSS TO DEVIKULAM-CHINNAKANAL  PANCHAYATH IN IDUKKI DISTRICT

Oil & Gas Rigs: Overall dimensions: 70 x110 m., Depth: up to 8.3 m
Total Project Cost INR 1,799 crores.

Project Description:
The project for saturation of 4G mobile services in uncovered villages across the country was approved on 27.07.2022 at a total cost of Rs. 26,316 crore.  The project will provide 4G mobile services in 24,680 uncovered villages in remote and difficult areas. The project has a provision to include 20% additional villages on account of rehabilitation, new-settlements, withdrawal of services by existing operators etc.

Project Description: Vizhinjam International Seaport Limited (VISL) is developing the Vizhinjam Seaport at Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The development is planned to be taken up in 3 phases (Phase I, II and III). In this regard, VISL has earlier obtained Environment/CRZ clearance from MoEF&CC vide its letter dated 3rd January 2014. A Comprehensive EIA including shoreline change assessment, modelling studies, public hearing and related studies were carried out for the master plan covering all 3 phases of development. The EC obtained was limited to Phase I development due to the then EC validity limit of 5 years. VISL now intends to take up development of the complete Master Plan within the existing port limits and for which necessary Environmental/CRZ Clearance is being sought. Development will not involve any additional land acquisition and need for R&R. Development will include construction of a berth length of 2670m and breakwater of 900m in addition to the Phase I lengths of 800m and 3180m respectively.
Project Name: Master Plan Development of Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Master plan development will be taken up within the defined port limits of Vizhinjam International Seaport

Project Description:
Blue Planet Palakkad Waste Solutions Pvt. Ltd. (BPPWSPL) has entered into a concession agreement with Kerala State Industrial Development Corporation (KSIDC) and twenty-Nine participating local bodies of Palakkad cluster to establish an Municipal Solid Waste Management Project with a Waste to Energy plant with a processing capacity of 200 TPD under “Design Build Finance Operate and Transfer (DBFOT) Basis.”
The facility will be developed in two phases viz.,
Phase I : Waste to Energy Plant comprising of Collection & Transport, segregation and Bio-Methanation (5,92 Acres)
Phase II for Sanitary Landfill for the inerts generated from Phase- I (5.08 Acres), which attracts EC under Schedule 7(i)  (Common Municipal Solid Waste Management Facility (CMSWMF) 
Total land area demarcated for landfill is 5.08 acre (including green belt) for phase II out of total 11 Acre provided to the Company. 
The landfill is designed for 25 years.
Organization Name: BLUE PLANET PALAKKAD WASTE SOLUTIONS PRIVATE LIMITED
Project Category: Common Municipal Solid Waste Management Facility (CMSWMF)
Project Name: Proposed Sanitary Landfill Development (Phase II)  For Disposing The Inerts Generated From Phase I Of The  200 TPD Waste-To-Energy Plant by M/s Blue Planet Palakkad Waste Solutions Pvt. Ltd
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The area is  exclusively allotted for this project in the Industrial area and belongs to District Industries Centre, Palakkad by Government of Kerala vide GO Nos.  82/2018/LSGD dated 11.06.2018 and 109/2022/ID dated 18/10/2022.

Project Description:
The project of Jal Jeevan Mission is aimed for providing portable drinking water to the entire area of Chakkupallam, Vandanmedu, Karunapuram and Vandiperiyar Panchayaths in Udumbanchola and Peerumedu Taluk in Idukki District of Kerala.
The scheme area is situated at south eastern part of Idukki district of Kerala. These panchayaths are surrounded Kumily at north, Theni District of State of Tamilnadu at east, Kattappana at south Peerumedu at west. The area is socially and economically in fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as higher living standards has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extend. The area being draught affected and inadequacy of existing water supply schemes has created acute water scarcity during summer. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayats.
Project Name: Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)-JJM : WSS TO CHAKKUPALLAM, VANDANMEDU, KARUNAPURAM AND VANDIPERIYAR PANCHAYATS IN IDUKKI DISTRICT
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description:
This study propose to establish a meteorological observatory with an Eddy Covariance instrument and hydrology measurements in the tropical evergreen forest ecosystem at Nankachi, near Kulathupuzha forest in Thiruvananthapuram. The measurements obtained from the tower will enhance our understanding of how the ecosystem of tropical evergreen forests interacts with the climate and atmospheric boundary layer in the Western Ghats region. Additionally, the critical zone hydrology data collected from the observatory will assist us in quantifying the influence of various biophysical processes in the forest on surface runoff and flood prediction.

The tower is 36 m tall and is equipped with various instruments, including Open Path CO2/H2O gas analyzers, a 3D sonic anemometer, a thermometer, sensors for wind speed and direction, rainfall sensors, atmospheric pressure sensors, profilers for soil moisture and soil temperature, radiometers, and canopy temperature sensors.
Organization Name: INDIAN INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE EDUCATION AND RESEARCH
Project Name: Setup a meteorology tower with eddy covariance and hydrology measurements at Nankachi, Thiruvananthapuram
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street:
Indian Institute of Science Education Research Thiruvananthapuram,
Maruthamala PO,
Vithura
Organization Legal Status: Central PSU (eg. NHAI, AAI, NTP, CIL, SAIL)

Project Description: The Project Named “JJM – WSS TO DEVIKULAM-CHINNAKANAL  PANCHAYATH IN IDUKKI DISTRICT”  is aimed for providing potable drinking water to the entire area of Devikulam and Chinnakanal Panchayaths in Idukki District of Kerala State. The scheme area is situated at the south North western part of Idukki district of Kerala. These areas are socially and economically in a fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as the higher living standard has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extent. The area is drought affected and acute water scarcity is being faced during summer. The existing water supply schemes to these areas are inadequate. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayats. It is proposed to include the water demand of this panchayat in the comprehensive scheme.

Project Description: The proposed Bridge is located at Banglavu Kadavu near Kuttampuzha grama panchayath across Kuttampuzhayar (a tributary of Periyar River) and which connects Kuttampuzha to Vadattupara. The width of the river in this portion is approximately 180m. People in the Vadattupara-Idamalayar area are depending on Kuttampuzha Panchayath, which is 27 km away, for all their requirements including Hospital, education, etc. Also the proposed bridge helps Tribal settlers and non-tribal settlers, living in the Vadattupara- Idamalayar area to reach Kuttampuzha easily. Hence a proposal put forth for the construction of the bridge and an investigation estimate is prepared for the same. Since one side the bridge and its approach roads i.e., Vadattupara- Idamalayar area are situated in Reserve Forest, permission / NOC from Forest Department is required for the construction of the bridge.
Organization Name: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER PWD BRIDGES DIVISION ERNAKULAM
Description: Form-C: For seeking prior approval for Exploration & Survey
Project Name: Investigation work for the Construction of Banglavu Kadavu Bridge in Kuttampuzha Panchayath in Ernakulam District

Project Description: Government of Kerala under Thiruvananthapuram Capital Region Development Project-II (CRDP) is planning to develop an Outer Ring Road (ORR) consisting of four lane (expandable up to six lane) highway for a length of about 77.773 km bifurcated into Northern Ring (29.800 Kms) and Southern Ring (47.973 Kms) as the principle project component along with designated planned development zones in the outer area at select locations earmarked for Special Invest Region (SIR). Separate EIA study has been carried out for Southern Ring following which the Environmental Clearance was granted by Kerala State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA) vide File No: 1143/EC/SEIAA/KL/2017, dated March 15, 2023. Now, Environmental Clearance is being sought for the Northern Ring of proposed ORR.
Project Name: Development of Proposed Outer Ring Road (Northern Ring: Navaikulam to Thekkada), Thiruvananthapuram
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Project is site specific and involves the development of ORR along the peripheral areas of Thiruvananthapuram where economic activity is constrained due to highly inadequate and inferior quality support infrastructure. Realignments have been considered to reduce the Environmental & social impacts likely to occur due to the development.

Project Description: Vizhinjam International Seaport Limited (VISL) is developing the Vizhinjam Seaport at  Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The development is planned to be taken up in 3 phases (Phase I, II and III). In this regard, VISL has earlier obtained Environment/CRZ clearance from MoEF&CC vide its letter dated 3rd January 2014. A Comprehensive EIA including shoreline change assessment, modelling studies, public hearing and related studies were carried out for the master plan covering all 3 phases of development. The EC obtained was limited to Phase I development due to the then EC validity limit of 5 years. VISL now intends to take up development of the complete Master Plan within the existing port limits and for which necessary Environmental/CRZ Clearance is being sought. Development will not involve any additional land acquisition and need for R&R. Development will include construction of a berth length of 2670m and breakwater of 900m in addition to the Phase I lengths of 800m and 3180m respectively.

Project Description: Vizhinjam International Seaport Limited (VISL) is developing the Vizhinjam Seaport at  Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The development is planned to be taken up in 3 phases (Phase I, II and III). In this regard, VISL has earlier obtained Environment/CRZ clearance from MoEF&CC vide its letter dated 3rd January 2014. A Comprehensive EIA including shoreline change assessment, modelling studies, public hearing and related studies were carried out for the master plan covering all 3 phases of development. The EC obtained was limited to Phase I development due to the then EC validity limit of 5 years. VISL now intends to take up development of the complete Master Plan within the existing port limits and for which necessary Environmental/CRZ Clearance is being sought. Development will not involve any additional land acquisition and need for R&R. Development will include construction of a berth length of 2670m and breakwater of 900m in addition to the Phase I lengths of 800m and 3180m respectively.
EC Consultant: Assystem India Limited (formerly known as L & T Infrastructure Engineering Ltd.)
Project Name: Master Plan Development of Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport at Vizhinjam, Kerala
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Master plan development will be taken up within the defined port limits of Vizhinjam International Seaport

Project Description:
The Project is aimed for providing potable drinking water to all households through FunctionalHouse hold tap connections (FHTC) to Kavalangadu Panchayath comprised in Kuttamangalam and Neriyamangalam Villages in Ernakulam District in Kerala State through Jal Jeevan Mission. Jal Jeevan Mission, a central government initiative under the ministry of Jal Sakthi, aims to ensure access of piped water for every household in India. 
Kavalangad Panchayath at the eastern part of Ernakulum district being a draught prone area during the lean months, reels under acute water scarcity. The existing water supply schemes in these areas are inadequate. Hence it is a matter of vital importance that a systematic and sustainable Water Supply Scheme is to be introduced for this region. 
Project proposes laying of 100 mm DI for pumping main to Menthandu water tank, and there is no alternate option than the proposed route though forest land. The distribution components consists of 150mm PVC and 90 mm PVC Pipe
Project Name: JJM-WSS to Kavalangad Panchayath
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street:
Project Division,Kerala Water Authority,Perumbavoor
KWA near Court Complex Perumbavoor

Project Description:
Department of Tourism (DoT), Government of Kerala (GoK) proposes to develop an inland cruise named “Theyyam and Malabari Cruise” along Valapattanam River, Kannur.

The proposed cruise along Valapattanam River for a length of 26km is a rediscovery of Malabars hidden gems such as Theyyam and Muthappan Cult. The boarding point of the cruise is at Pazhayangadi. There are 17 intermediate locations proposed along the route till AKG Island wherein the tourists get an opportunity to explore regions that are rich in cultural heritage, a truly village life, Malabari food, inland fishing and skill of the region which is unexplored so far. 
A 26 km Inland River Cruise is proposed with a theme of “Theyyam” where the villages along the various jetty locations would be show casing the Malabar’s hidden gems - theyyam and Muthappan cult.
Project Name: Development	of	“Theyyam	and	Malabari	Cruise”	along Valapattanam River, Kannur
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: Jal Jeevan mission aims to provide functional household tap connections in India by 2024. The Water supply scheme “Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)- WSS to Konnathady, Udumbanchola, and Rajakkad, Bisonvally, Rajakumary (part), Senapathy (part) Panchayath in Idukki District'' is aimed to provide potable drinking water to the entire population of Konnathady, Udumbanchola, and Rajakkad, Bisonvally and parts of Rajakumary and Senapathy Grama Panchayaths in Idukki District of Kerala State.The scheme area is situated at the south North western part of Idukki district of Kerala. These areas are socially and economically in a fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as the higher living standard has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extent. The area is drought affected and acute water scarcity is being faced during summer. The existing water supply schemes to these areas are inadequate. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayats. It
Project Name: Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)- WSS to Konnathady, Udumbanchola, and Rajakkad, Bisonvally, Rajakumary (part), Senapathy (part) Panchayath in Idukki District

Project Description: The proposed development is for Construction of a Cable Stayed/Suspension Bridge across Ponnani estuary with Approaches. The project is part of the Coastal Highway wherein the proposed alignment will be linking the two points on southern side the Ponnani Junction (NH 66Bypass) and Northern side Padinjarekkara-Kuttayi Road. The project corridor starts at the Ponnani Junction (between Palakkad-Ponnani Road and Panvel-Kochi-Kanyakumari Highway of NH-66) and ends at Padinjarekara beach after crossing the Bharathapuzha River. Total length of proposed development corridor, including the bridge structure, is ~ 4.80 kms. The bridge structure is planned across mouth of Bharathapuzha River where the river meets Arabian Sea in Ponnani.
Organization Name: ROADS AND BRIDGES DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION OF KERALA LTD
Project Name: Construction of Cable Stayed/Suspension Bridge across Ponnani Estuary with approaches, Malappuram, Kerala
Alternative Site Examined: YES

Project Description:
The existing Idukki Hydroelectric Project is the biggest Hydroelectric Project in Kerala. It comprises of three dams at Idukki, Cheruthony and Kulamavu and related systems. The project is in Periyar River Basin in Kerala. The Installed capacity of this existing project is 780 MW. The powerhouse has six generators of 130 MW capacity each. The project was completed in three stages in Year 1976, 1987 and 1991. FRL of this project is as El. 732.43m and provide a live storage between FRL & MDDL is 1459.50 MCM.
The proposed scheme envisages construction of a powerhouse to be located adjacent to texisting Moolamattom power house of Idukki Project together with an intake structure from existing Kulamavu reservoir, power tunnel, pressure shaft, tail race tunnel etc. the tail race tunnel would discharge its water through open channel into Thodupuzha River. The proposal is to install 800 MW (4 x 200) of machines under this Idukki Extension scheme.
Organization Name: CHIEF ENGINEER (CIVIL- INVESTIGATION & CONSTRUCTION CENTRAL), KSEBL
Description: Form-C: For seeking prior approval for Exploration & Survey
Project Name: IDUKKI EXTENSION HYDRO ELECTRIC PROJECT
Alternative Site Examined: YES

Project Description:
Pinavoor SHP,  7.00 MW run-of-river project,  assigned by the Government of Kerala through G.O.(Ms) No. 8/2023/POWER Dt. 01-08-2023, in accordance with Kerala SHP policy 2012, to Er. Baby Alex, MD, SPV Cochin Hydro Power (Pinavoor) Pvt Ltd. The project is at Mamalakandam and Pinavoorkudy Wards of Kuttapuzha Panchayath, Ernakulam Dt., falls under territorial jurisdiction of Neriamangalm Range, Munnar Div.
This run-of-river project utilizes 2.71 Cumecs flow of Mamalathodu, a stream drains to Kuttapuzha, a tributary of Periyar River. It has a head of 335 meters to the Power House site at Pinavoorkudy, generating 19.08 Mu/Year
The project features a Trench weir, intake gate, stilling pool, open channel, tunnel, surge tank, penstock, surface power house, switchyard. Tailwater is discharged back into the Kuttampuzha. Power is evacuated through 33Kv UG cables along Pinavoorkudi to Link tower switchyard at Randam Mile via forest and to KSEB 110/220 KV line Tower PV- KLM No 092
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO for Scrutiny and Recommendation
Project Name: PINAVOOR SHP 7.0 MW
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: No. 2/414 Mannamplackal, Thottumugam, Aluva

Project Description: The Project named “Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)- WSS to Kudayathoor, Muttom  and Karimkunnam Panchayath in Idukki District'' ” is aimed for providing potable drinking water to the entire area of Kudayathoor, Muttom  and Karimkunnam Panchayaths in Idukki  District of Kerala. These Panchayaths are socially and economically in fast developing stage and lack of reliable water supply schemes has led to an acute water scarcity. Hence it is very necessary to implement sustainable WSS to these panchayaths. The areas being drought affected during summer season worsen the situation further. Hence new schemes are proposed to meet the water demand at a rate of 100lpcd in rural areas for a design period of 30 years from 2023. In order to provide, the water treated at the Water Treatment Plant located in Muttom to the parts of Kudayathoor and Muttom panchayaths clear water pumping mains  has to be laid through forest land.
Project Name: Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) -WSS to Kudayathoor, Muttom & karimkunnam Panchayath in Idukki District
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street:

Project Description: Existing three 12-inch pipelines originate from Kochi Refinery at Ambalamugal, were laid underground in the BPCL pipeline corridor for approx. 9 Km length and subsequently in city area for approx. 1.5 km length. These pipelines emerges above ground at North Jetty Reclamation Pit (NJRP) in the Cochin Port Authority Premises. New 20" and 12" pipelines are proposed to be laid after dismantling of existing three 12" pipelines from Kochi Refinery to NJRP in the same route. Length of the new pipeline is approx. 10.5 Km each (approx. 9 km in BPCL Pipeline corridor and approx. 1.5 km in city area). Project also envisages laying of new 24" pipeline from NJRP to Cochin Oil Terminal (COT), this pipeline will be laid through Horizontal Directional Drilling (HDD) method under sea bed upto Sand bank island (near COT) approx. 1 Km and further on pipe trestle approx. 500 meters upto COT.
Project Name: Laying a new 24” line from North Jetty Reclamation Pit (NJRP) to Cochin Oil Terminal (COT) and replacement of three numbers of old 12” lines with one 12” line & one 20” line in CRZ area, as part of the project to replace these lines from Kochi Refinery to NJRP.
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: The project is proposed by V. Somasekharan Nair at Aruvikkara Village, Nedumangad Taluk, Thiruvananthapuram District, Kerala. Total mine lease area is 4.5116 ha. Main rock type in the lease area is Garnateferrous Biotite Gneiss of Khondalite Suite. The project is proposed for the extraction of Khondalite for Granite building stone. Average proposed production per annum is f around 2,76,100 T (1st year), 2,76,210 T (2nd year & 3rd year), 2,68,290 T (4th year), 2,74,725 T (5th year to 8th year), 2,66,558 T (9th year) and 2,25,147 (10th year) through open cast mechanized method of mining with bench system. Expected life of mine is 10 years.
Project Name: Re-appraisal of EC issued by DEIAA through SEAC/SEIAA, Kerala for the project Granite Building Stone Quarry of V. Somasekharan Nair

Project Description:
The NH 766 is the primary road link between Kozhikode and Wayanad. The 11.5 km long Thamarassery Churam is of steep gradient with nine hairpin bends and through forestland. Earth slips from the fragile slopes cause traffic blocks, accidents. It is not feasible to improve the width or geometry of this Ghat Section. 
Government of Kerala has decided to construct the proposed project of 8.735 km long Twin Tube Unidirectional Tunnel Road (2+2 Lane) with Four Lane Approach connecting two districts Kozhikode and Wayanad of Kerala State to ease the congestion of the Thamarassery Ghat road and also to provide a reliable, safe, all-weather road connectivity for the ever increasing traffic.
The proposed project is formed by connecting existing MDR (Anakkampoyil-Muthappanpuzha-Marippuzha road) to SH 59 (Meppadi-Kalladi-Chooramala road). The tunnel road is proposed to be an extension of existing SH 59 by PWD and hence attracts the EIA Notification 2006 and falls under 7 (f) Highways – B Category
Organization Name: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER KERALA PUBLIC WORKS DEPARTMENT ROADS DIVISION, KOZHIKODE
Project Name: Construction of Twin Tube Unidirectional Tunnel Road (2+2 Lane) with Four Lane Approach(from existing roads) for providing direct connectivity between Anakkampoyil-Kalladi -Meppadi in Kozhikode and Wayanad Districts of Kerala State
Alternative Site Examined: YES

Project Description:
It falls under the sector -River Valley. 
It is a new proposal to construct a New Dam which falls in the downstream (366 m) of the existing Mullaperiyar dam.
The existing dam is very old (128 years old) and for the safety of downstream men, materials, and flora-fauna the proponent is going for new dam construction. The existing dam will be demolished after the construction of the new dam.
The existing and new proposed dams are falling in PTR sensitive area
Last Visible Status: Proposal Accepted and Referred to EAC
Project Name: New Mullaperiyar Dam
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Two other nearby locations considered. But location near to the existing dam is selected because of the following reasons,  •	Less forest land requirement.   •Less submergence area,  •Less ecological damage.  •Economically feasible

Project Description: An incident of electrocution of an elephant  on 16-09-2023 under Electrical section Agali was reported by Executive Engineer Electrical Division Mannarkkad and KSEB higher authority directed to convert the existing bare lines through forest area to insulated conductors as preventive measures to avoid such untoward situations to wild animals. Again Malayattoor -Kurishumudi being an international pilgrim center, where millions of people are gathered annually and the electrical installations shall be made safe. So it is proposed to convert the existing LT OH Bare conductor to Insulated ABC conductors, after inserting few new poles along the  existing line route to standardize the line and to avoid its sag.

Project Description:
Azhikkal Port is one of the non-major port under the administrative control of KMB. It is an ancient riverside port of wharf length 226 m located at confluence of Valapattanam River and Mattol River in Kannur district of Kerala. Fishing vessels at Azhikkal Fishing harbor and passenger vessels of State Water Transport Department (SWTD) operates within Port limit. 
Manual dredging has been in practice within Port limit to maintain sufficient draft of 3.5 m to 4 m along navigable areas of Port limit. It is proposed to dredge the navigation channel within the Port Limit of Azhikkal and the material shall be stored in Kadavus and after filtration, the same shall be sold out as construction material. The dredging areas and proposed Kadavus falls within the Coastal Regulation Zone.
Project Name: Manual Dredging at Azhikkal Port Limits for Maintaining Navigational Channel Depth and Filtration of Dredged Sand at Kadavus.

Project Description:
The Project Named "JJM - WSS TO ARAKKULAM & VELLIYAMATTAM 
PANCHAYATH IN IDUKKI DISTRICT" is aimed for providing potable drinking water to the 
entire area of Arakkulam and Velliyamattom (part) Panchayaths in Idukki District of Kerala State 
through separate packages for low level and high level zones. These areas are socially and 
economically in a fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as the higher living slandard 
has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extent. The area is drought affected and 
acute water scareity is being faced during summer. The existing water supply schemes to these 
areas are inadequate. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable water supply 
scheme to these panchayats. It is proposed to include the water demand of this panchayat in the 
comprehensive scheme.
Project Name: JJM WSS to Arakkulam and Velliyamattom( part) panchayaths in Idukki District

Project Description: Government of Kerala has enabled policies and established agencies to support Solid Waste Management (SWM) activities across the state. Kerala has planned to enhance the SWM services in the state needs further improvement particularly, in various infrastructure and service delivery systems across the value chain. This includes engineered landfills for secured landfilling of inert waste/rejects generated from the Municipal solid waste. Kerala State Solid Waste Management Project (KSWMP), under Local Self Government Department (LSGD), is implementing the Solid Waste Management Project in 93 ULBs (87 municipalities and 6 corporations).Cluster-4 (Ambalamedu) is identified, to manage MSW inert rejects generated initially from four districts namely Ernakulam, Alappuzha, Kottayam, and Idukki, and later the MSW inert / rejects from other Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) shall be assigned to the Ambalamedu RSLF/ SLF by Govt. of Kerala on a need to basis.
EC Consultant: ABC Techno Labs India Private Limited (formerly known as ABC Environ Solutions Pvt. Ltd.)
Project Category: Common Municipal Solid Waste Management Facility (CMSWMF)
Project Name: Proposed Scientific Landfill for KSWMP at Ambalamedu,Ernakulam District, Kerala State
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: The existing 11kV line from Boundry to Malayinchi via Alkallu transformer under Electrical section Karimannoor is passing through the highly vegetated area and causing more interruption and very difficult to patrol the line through hilly and vegetated area. And also this area is very hilly terrain and very difficult to restore power supply during night and in  rainy season.  To avoid these difficulties it is proposed to re route this line through the PWD Road using ABC cable . There are 817 connections and about 2000 people including thousands of students living in this area and it is very difficult to give uninterrupted power supply . Due to this more complaints received from people and local authorities from there. Hence it is decided to rerouting this line through Boundry – Malayinchi road by Board’s own fund during 2024-25. The Project amount comes to Rs. 10252294/-. As the proposal  is by drawing 4.8KM ABC(Ariel Bunched Cable) instead of bare overhead line .
Project Name: Re-routing of existing 11kV line from Boundry to Malayinchi via Alkallu Transformer at Electrical Section Karimannoor
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: Assistant Engineer, Electrical Section, Vannappuram

Project Description: The JJM project Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)-JJM CWSS to Vattavada panchayath in idukki district- Construction of RCC Weir across Chilandhiyarriver at Chilandhiyar in Vattavada Panchayath aims to provide functional household tap connections to 617 households in the first phase in Vattavada Panchayat. In the envisaged project area, there are no protected water sources and piped water facilities The mission's goal is not only to provide tap water connections but also to ensure that every home receives drinking water in adequate quantity and prescribed quality on a regular and long-term basis. Therefore, selecting a sustainable water source is essential. The proposal for the Project is to construct a weir in the Silandhiyar to ensure a stable and sufficient supply of raw water for the proposed 3 MLD water treatment plant at Silandhiyar Karuppasamy Temple .
Project Name: Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)-JJM CWSS to Vattavada panchayath in idukki district- Construction of RCC Weir across Chilandhiyarriver at Chilandhiyar in Vattavada Panchayath

Project Description: In 1950s land was allotted to public at Pampavalley under Grow More Food programme.Later, the Consultative Committee of Parliament on Kerala Legislation on the report of the Sub Committee (the Maniyangadan Committee) recommended that the area called Pampa Valley food production area not be included in the Game Sanctuary and its occupants need not be evicted on condition that there is no further encroachments. The recommendation of the Sub Committee was accepted. The total extent of the land is 502.723 Ha and number of families  are 2851 now. The State Board for Wildlife, Kerala, decided to exclude the Pampa Valley settlement from Periyar Tiger Reserve during the meeting held on 19.01.2023. The present extent of the Periyar Tiger Reserve is 925 Km², as on exclusion of Pampa Valley settlement (502.723 Ha), the extent of the Periyar Tiger Reserve will be reduced to 919.97 Km².
Project Name: Proposal for the denotification of Pampa Valley Settelment from Periyar Tiger Reserve
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: NOT APPLICABLE

Project Description: The Valupara-Kakkad 220kV line proposed under TransGrid2.0 project, which is one among the 5 flagship projects of Govt. of Kerala under “Urga Kerala Mission”, envisaged to strengthen intra-state transmission grid network. This is the only feeder to energise the new 220/110kV GIS substation at Seethathode, scheduled to commission on 12/2024. It is aimed to establish 220kV grid connectivity between Sabagiri HEP and 220kV Ambalamugal grid SS to evacuate 50MW power from Seethathode HEP and thereby saving 5MW power by reducing transmission losses and a benefit of 21.6 Cr./year to the exchequer of KSEBL. It also provides 110kV power supply to the proposed 110kV Nilackal SS to meet the power requirement of the Famous Sabarimala Temple and related pilgrim centres. It avoids the huge revenue losses due to restriction of generation/spill over of water from Moozhiyar dam during the failure existing transmission evacuation line and also avoiding the shutdown of 6 hydel PHs of 94MW capacity.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO/CF/Nodal Officer after acceptance in PSC-I
Project Name: Sabari Lines Package - Construction of 220KV Double circuit line from Valupara to Kakkad
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: Office of the Director (T&SO),Vydhuthi Bhavanam,Pattom, Thiruvananthapuram

Project Description: The JJM project Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)-JJM CWSS to Vattavada panchayath in idukki district- Construction of RCC Weir across Chilandhiyarriver at Chilandhiyar in Vattavada Panchayath aims to provide functional household tap connections to 617 households in the first phase in Vattavada Panchayat. In the envisaged project area, there are no protected water sources and piped water facilities The mission's goal is not only to provide tap water connections but also to ensure that every home receives drinking water in adequate quantity and prescribed quality on a regular and long-term basis. Therefore, selecting a sustainable water source is essential. The proposal for the Project is to construct a weir in the Silandhiyar to ensure a stable and sufficient supply of raw water for the proposed 3 MLD water treatment plant at Silandhiyar Karuppasamy Temple.
Project Name: Jal Jeevan Mission-JJM CWSS to Vattavada panchayath in idukki district- Construction of RCC Weir across Chilandhiyarriver at Chilandhiyar in Vattavada Panchayath
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: The proposed project is the laying of natural gas pipeline over a length of 22 km from Chithari Fuels at Kanhangad to KSRTC Bus Stand, Kasaragod. This pipeline will receive natural gas from the Kochi – Koottanad –Bengaluru – Mangaluru Pipeline (KKBMPL) laid by Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL). The pipeline will be laid along the utility corridor of existing roads, mainly SH 57. The pipeline will be laid 1.50 m to 1.70 m below ground level (bgl) along roads by open cut method, 3.0 m to 10.0 m bgl at water body crossings by Horizontal Directional Drilling (HDD) method and 3.0 to 12.0 m bgl at railway crossing by Micro-tunnelling with casing method. This pipelaying is the Phase 2 installation of existing PNG pipeline of IOAGPL at Kasaragod District ending at Chithari Fuels at Kanhangad, having nearest City Gas tap-off station at Ambalathara. The construction period of the project is estimated to be 24 months and the mobilization period will be 1 month.
Project Name: Laying & Construction of 8″ & 4″ NB U/G Steel Pipeline Network & Associated works at IOAGPL Kannur-Kasaragod GA-Phase 2
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The alignment is the best optimized route to ensure distribution of PNG to maximum number of houses, vehicle fueling stations, commercial establishments and industrials units with minimum disturbance to habitation/ shops/ vegetation, etc. along the sides of the road through which the pipeline alignment is proposed. Thus, no alternatives sites were considered.

Project Description: The proposed project is the laying of natural gas pipeline over a length of 6.3 km from Maheshwari Arcade, Arakkinar to Syline Oceanic, Mananchira at Kozhikode District. The proposed pipeline will carry PNG at an operating pressure of around 25 bar for its distribution to various potential domestic, transportation, commercial and industrial customers. The proposed pipeline will cross the Kallayi River near Kothi Bridge at Kozhikode. Out of the total length of 6.3 km, 3.61 km lies in CRZ area and 2.71 km lies outside CRZ area. Carbon Steel pipes of specification API 5L Gr.-X- 42 with 4" diameter and 6.40 mm thickness will be mainly used. The method of pipelaying will be Horizontal Directional Drilling (HDD) method throughout the proposed alignment. The pipeline will be laid 1.2 m below ground level (bgl) along roads and 2.5 m below scour depth across Kallayi river. The design life of the pipeline is 30 years.
Project Name: Laying, Expanding and Operating of Natural Gas Transportation Pipeline Network with Associated Facilities at Kozhikode & Wayanad Districts GA (Start Point near to Maheshwari Arcade and End Point near to Skyline Oceanic)
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The alignment is the best optimized route to ensure distribution of PNG to maximum number of houses, vehicle fueling stations, commercial establishments and industrials units with minimum disturbance to habitation/ shops/ vegetation, etc. along the sides of the road through which the pipeline alignment is proposed. Thus, no alternatives sites were considered.

EC vide 147/Q/2024 dated 16/07/2024 was obtained for the project life of 4 years with third specific conditions of “The depth of mining should be limited to 50m above MSL to prevent the intersection with ground water table and thereby limiting the mineable resources to 1395603 MT and as per KMCCR, 2015 and KMMCR amendment, 2023 the mining lease can be executed only if the life of mine is equal of greater than 5 years. Project Description:
The 11 KV Achankovil feeder from the Thenmala 66 KV substation reaches Achankovil via Ayyappankana, Nagamala, Kuravanthavalam, and Priya Estate. The line from Ayyappankana to Nagamala passes through a reserve forest area where wild animals roam freely. It is common for elephants to knock down trees and disrupt the power supply. There have also been incidents of falling trees and snapping live conductors, posing a danger to wild animals. Moreover, it is very difficult and dangerous to locate and resolve power outages that occur at night.
Therefore, this project has been prepared to eliminate the existing overhead power line (aerial line) from Thenmala Ayyappankana to Nagamala Bungalow and instead lay an underground cable through the forest path along this route. This will minimize power interruptions of the T feeder, reduce electrical accidents, and enable an uninterrupted power supply. This project is being implemented through the Central Aided Project (RDSS) scheme.
Last Visible Status: Pending at UA due to EDS by DFO
Organization Name: Kerala State Electricity Board Ltd. Thenmala Electrical Section
Project Name: Laying 2.5 KM 11 KV XLPE (3Cx300sq.mm) underground cable from Ayyappankana to Nagamala Bungalow through Forest land by replacing the existing 11KV Overhead line under KSEB Ltd. Electrical Section Thenmala on RDSS project of Central Government
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Office of the Assistant engineer
KSEB Ltd
Electrical Section Thenmala

Project Description:
Vizhinjam International Seaport Limited (VISL) is developing the Vizhinjam Seaport at Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The development is planned to be taken up in 3 phases (Phase I, II and III). In this regard, VISL has earlier obtained Environment/CRZ clearance from MoEF&CC vide its letter dated 3rd January 2014. A Comprehensive EIA including shoreline change assessment, modelling studies, public hearing and related studies were
carried out for the master plan covering all 3 phases of development.
The EC obtained was limited to Phase I development due to the then EC
validity limit of 5 years. VISL now intends to take up development of the
complete Master Plan within the existing port limits and for which necessary Environmental/CRZ Clearance is being sought. Development will not involve any additional land acquisition and need for R&R. Development will include construction of a berth length of 2670m and breakwater of 900m in addition to the Phase I lengths of 800m and 3180m respectively.
Project Name: Master Plan Development of Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport

Project Description: Vizhinjam International Seaport Limited (VISL) is developing the Vizhinjam Seaport at Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The development is planned to be taken up in 3 phases (Phase I, II and III). In this regard, VISL has earlier obtained Environment/CRZ clearance from MoEF&CC vide its letter dated 3rd January 2014. The EC was limited for Phase I development which is currently in advance stage of construction. However, the project development has not progressed as planned and has encountered delays due to various reasons. Due to these delays, the activities as planned to be taken up under Phase I development cannot be completed within existing EC validity period of January 02, 2025. Hence, in order to complete balance activities with a valid EC, an extension of EC validity, based on the available provisions of MoEF&CC vide OM’s dated April 12, 2022 and December 13, 2022, is being sought for a period of 1 year.
Description: Application for Validity Extension of EC- Form-6
Project Name: Environmental and CRZ Clearance for Development of Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport at Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram District, Kerala by M/s Vizhinjam International Seaport Ltd

Project Description:
Azhikkal Port is one of the non-major port under the administrative control of KMB. It is an ancient riverside port of wharf length 226 m located at confluence of Valapattanam River and Mattol River in Kannur district of Kerala. Fishing vessels at Azhikkal Fishing harbor and passenger vessels of State Water Transport Department (SWTD) operates within Port limit. 
Manual dredging has been in practice within Port limit to maintain sufficient draft of 3.5 m to 4 m along navigable areas of Port limit. It is proposed to dredge the navigation channel within the Port Limit of Azhikkal and the material shall be stored in Kadavus and after filtration, the same shall be sold out as construction material. The dredging areas and proposed Kadavus falls within the Coastal Regulation Zone.
Project Name: Manual Dredging at Azhikkal Port Limits for Maintaining Navigational Channel Depth and Filtration of Dredged Sand at Kadavus.
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Exemption Reason: Maintenance dredging provided the dredged material shall be disposed within port limits

Project Description:
The major portion of Karavoor 11 KV feeder from 110 KV Substation Pathanapuram passes through thickly vegetated forest area. The line from Olappara to Kottakkayam passes through the reserve forest area where wild animals are roaming freely. It is common the Elephants uproot trees or break high girth tree branches and being thrown towards the line and interrupt power supply. There has also incident of falling trees and snapping live conductors, it may cause fatal accidents to wild animals. Moreover, it is very difficult and dangerous to locate and resolve Power outages that occurs at night and at the natural calamity. 
Therefore, this project is proposed to dismantling the existing overhead line from Olappara to Kottakkayam and there by laying the Underground Cable. This will reduce interruptions to minimum level and avoid accidents. This Project is being implemented through Central Aided Project (RDSS) scheme.
Organization Name: Kerala State Electricity Board Ltd. Piravanthoor Electrical Section
Project Name: Laying 5 KM 11KV XLPE Underground Cable from Olappara to Kottakkayam by replacing the existing Overhead line under KSEB Ltd. Electrical Section, Piravanthoor on RDSS scheme of Central Government
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street:
Office of the Assistant Engineer
KSEB Ltd
ELectrical Section
Piravanthoor
Kollam (Dist) Kerala

Project Description: Vizhinjam International Seaport Limited (VISL) is developing the Vizhinjam Seaport at  Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The development is planned to be taken up in 3 phases (Phase I, II and III). In this regard, VISL has earlier obtained Environment/CRZ clearance from MoEF&CC vide its letter dated 3rd January 2014. A Comprehensive EIA including shoreline change assessment, modelling studies, public hearing and related studies were carried out for the master plan covering all 3 phases of development. The EC obtained was limited to Phase I development due to the then EC validity limit of 5 years. VISL now intends to take up development of the complete Master Plan within the existing port limits and for which necessary Environmental/CRZ Clearance is being sought. Development will not involve any additional land acquisition and need for R&R. Development will include construction of a berth length of 2670m and breakwater of 900m in addition to the Phase I lengths of 800m and 3180m respectively.
Project Name: Master Plan Development of Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport at Vizhinjam, Kerala
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Master plan development will be taken up within the defined port limits of Vizhinjam International Seaport

Project Description: SEIAA, Kerala, granted E C to the quarry project of M/s. Yesco Granites LLP vide File No - 1573/EC3/2019/SEIAA, Proposal No. SIA/KL/MIN/46586/2019 for a period of 5 years, considering the mineable resources of 3,52,995 MT and annual production of 25,000 MT. The EC was granted with specific conditions that to reduce the depth of mining to prevent intersection with the groundwater table and halting all mining activities at an elevation of 85 m above MSL. Even though the EC is granted by the SEIAA, the quarrying operations are not started yet.. As per KMMCR amendment, 2023 the he maximum period for a quarrying permit shall be 3 years. In compliance with these conditions, A modified mining plan with PMCP , which restricting mining activities to elevations above 85 meters MSL with a projected mine life of 3 years. Consequently, the mineable reserve has been recalculated and reduced to 2,06,580 MT. The maximum annual production of proposed to be 80,000 MTA.
Description: Application for Amendment in EC- Form-4

Project Description: SEIAA Kerala, granted EC to the quarry project of M/s. Malabar Granite Industries vide File No. 2215/EC/2023/SEIAA, Proposal No. SIA/KL/MIN/410913/2022 for a period of 10 years, considering the mineable resources of 3,46,.900 MT and annual production of 34,690 MT. As per the recommendation, fourth specific conditions were “The depth of mining should be limited to 80 m above MSL considering the depth of water table.” The quarrying operations are not started yet. Since the quarrying lease is not executed till now. In compliance with these conditions, a modified mining plan with PMCP has been approved by Dept. of mining and geology which restricting mining activities to 80 meters AMSL with a projected mine life of 5 years. Consequently, the mineable reserve has been recalculated and reduced to 3,18,935 MT. The maximum annual production of minerals is proposed to be 80,000 metric tons per annum (MTA).

Average proposed production per annum is f around 2,76,100 T (1st year), 2,76,210 T (2nd year & 3rd year), 2,68,290 T (4th year), 2,74,725 T (5th year to 8th year), 2,66,558 T (9th year) and 2,25,147 (10th year) through open cast mechanized method of mining with bench system. Expected life of mine is 10 years.
EC Consultant: ABC Techno Labs India Private Limited (formerly known as ABC Environ Solutions Pvt. Ltd.)
Project Name: Re-appraisal of EC issued by DEIAA through SEAC/SEIAA, Kerala for the project Granite Building Stone Quarry of V. Somasekharan Nair

Project Description:
An eco-resort with a built-up area of 709.38 sqm in a privately owned land of Paniyeliporu Resorts and Hotels Pvt Ltd. Access to this eco-resort is only through the a 4 kmlong road named Paniyeli-Kayattuva-Pezhadu road that runs through the Reserve Forest of Malayattoor Forest Division. This road starts from the ecotourism centre, Paniyeliporu and has been regularly used by around forty local residents who live in the area, as well as over a hundred individuals who own property nearby. In addition to serving the local community, the road functions as an operational route for the Kerala Water Authority. Notably, the Forest Department organizes day treks for up to 2,000 people each day to the Paniyeli bathing point, which is located in proximity to the resort.
This proposal is for availing permission to access this road for operating the eco-resort (Quiet By The River - operated by CGH Group)
Project Name: Quiet By The River operated by CGH Group
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Privately owned land of Paniyeliporu Resorts and Hotels Pvt Ltd in Vengoor Grama Panchayath

Project Description:
Established in 1975, the Kerala Forest Development Corporation (KFDC) manages Kerala's forests, owned by the State (90%) and Central (10%) governments. With a lease expiring in 2025, renewal is needed. KFDC cultivates timber, pulpwood, bamboo, cashew, and manages eco-tourism across significant forest plantations.

Facing renewal challenges due to the Forest Conservation Act amendment 2023 regarding long-rotation crops, KFDC argues its activities qualify as forestry. They adhere to eco-restoration, replacing exotics with native species, aiming for full conversion by 2040. KFDC seeks lease renewal without NPV or compensatory afforestation, citing their forestry activities and alignment with state policy.
Description: Form-B (Part-I): Renewal of Lease on Forest Land
Project Name: Lease Renewal of Kerala Forest Development Corporation's Forest Plantations
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: The Project Named "JJM - WSS TO ARAKKULAM & VELLIYAMATTAM PANCHAYATH IN IDUKKI DISTRICT" is aimed for providing potable drinking water to the entire area of Arakkulam and Velliyamattom (part) Panchayaths in Idukki District of Kerala State through separate packages for low level and high level zones. These areas are socially and economically in a fast developing stage. Growth of population as well as the higher living slandard has increased the demand of water in this area to a great extent. The area is drought affected and acute water scarcity is being faced during summer. The existing water supply schemes to these areas are inadequate. Hence it is very much necessary to implement sustainable water supply scheme to these panchayats. It is proposed to include the water demand of this panchayat in the comprehensive scheme.

Project Description: The Idamalayar Extension Scheme (75 MW) is proposed by KSEBL to meet Kerala’s rising power demand. It is an extension scheme to the existing Idamalayar Hydroelectric scheme. For DPR preparation, geotechnical investigation is required, including drilling 10 boreholes with a core diameter of 2.15 inches (NX size) within the Malayattoor Forest Division. Each borehole requires an area of 16 sq.m. The investigation involves core sampling as per GSI recommendations and is essential for finalizing the project alignment. No tree felling or permanent structures are involved. The activity is temporary, research-oriented, and causes minimal disturbance. The intended to study and assess the geological characteristics of of the site. The samples collected will be used exclusively for research purposes only. The proposal is submitted through Form C on the PARIVESH portal for forest clearance, as per the MoEF&CC Notification dated 29.11.2023 and its clarification dated December .2024.

Project Description: The existing Mulleriya-Periyadka road in the 11th ward of Karadukka Grama Panchayat is 500 meters long as per the Panchayat Asset Register. Out of this, 450 meters of the road passes through the land owned by the Forest Department. The administrative committee meeting discussed the application submitted to obtain permission from the Forest Department to concrete the said road and renovate it. The meeting assessed that about 70 families including ST/SC are users of this road and since it is an endosulfan affected area, this road is the only refuge for endosulfan affected people and other bedridden patients. The meeting assessed that it is very necessary to concrete the said road even in the situation where the deplorable condition of the road through the forest area makes travel difficult. The meeting unanimously decided to request the Forest Department for permission to concrete the said road, which is very beneficial for the local residents.
Project Name: Mulleria -Periyadka Road
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: The Secretary,Karadka Grama Panchayath, Mulleria Post,Kasaragod Dist, Kerala ,671543

Project Description: The Poringalkuthu Small Hydro Electric Project – Stage II (1×24 MW) is a capacity expansion of the existing Stage-I project,commissioned in May 2022 by KSEB Ltd, utilizing excess water spill from the Poringalkuthu reservoir in coordination with existing schemes like Poringalkuthu  (1X24 MW), PLBE (1×16 MW), and Poringalkuthu LB (4×9 MW). The proposed components—penstock extension, valve house, power house extension, and tailrace pool—will be constructed entirely within the 4.92 ha of forest land already leased for Stage-I, with no additional submergence, land acquisition, or infrastructure required, The existing dam and intake systems for Stage I  will be shared for Stage II scheme. As per the direction of the Forest Department in the meeting held on 07.07.2025 with the PCCF, the proposal is being submitted through Form-E in the PARIVESH portal for re-diversion of the already leased forest land.

Project Description: An eco-resort with a built-up area of 709.38 sqm in a privately owned land of Paniyeliporu Resorts and Hotels Pvt Ltd. Access to this eco-resort is only through the a 3.3 km long  & 3m wide road named Paniyeli-Kayattuva-Vettanpara - Pezhadu road that runs through the Reserve Forest of Malayattoor Forest Division. This road starts from the ecotourism centre, Paniyeliporu and has been regularly used by around forty local residents who live in the area, as well as over a hundred individuals who own property nearby. The road also regularly maintained (concreting) by the Vengoor Grama Panchayath for the access. In addition to serving the local community, the road functions as an operational route for the Kerala Water Authority. Notably, the Forest Department organizes day treks for up to 2,000 people each day to the Paniyeli bathing point, which is located in proximity to the resort. This proposal is for availing permission to access this road for operating the eco resort.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO for Scrutiny and Recommendation
Project Name: Quiet By The River operated by CGH Group

Project Description:
This application is for the renewal of the forest lease for land managed by the Kerala Forest Development Corporation (KFDC), which is set to expire in December 2025. Established in 1975, KFDC manages forests in Kerala, with ownership split between the State (90%) and Central (10%) governments.
KFDC's activities within the leased area are entirely silvicultural, focusing on the cultivation of long-rotation crops such as timber, pulpwood, and bamboo, alongside the management of eco-tourism. These plantation activities strictly fall under the definition of forestry as per Section 2(iii) of the Forest (Conservation) Amendment Act, 2023.
In line with the State Government's ecorestoration policy, KFDC has initiated a program to replace exotic species with native ones, with a target for full conversion by 2040. All KFDC activities have been conducted in accordance with a management plan approved by the Ministry of Environment, Forest, and Climate Change (MoEFCC) prior to 1980.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO/CF/Nodal Officer after acceptance in PSC-I
Description: Form-D (Part-I): Signing of Lease (section 2(iii)) on Forest Land
Project Name: Lease Renewal of Kerala Forest Development Corporation,s Forest Plantations
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: Aaranyakom, Kottayam - Thiruvarppu road, Near Bheemanpadi Junction, Karapuzha
Organization Legal Status: State PSU (eg. State Forest Corp., TANGEDCO, Mineral development Corp)

Project Description: The existing Mulleriya-Periyadka road in the 11th ward of Karadukka Grama Panchayat is 500 meters long as per the Panchayat Asset Register. Out of this, 450 meters of the road passes through the land owned by the Forest Department. The administrative committee meeting discussed the application submitted to obtain permission from the Forest Department to concrete the said road and renovate it. The meeting assessed that about 70 families including ST/SC are users of this road and since it is an endosulfan affected area, this road is the only refuge for endosulfan affected people and other bedridden patients. The meeting assessed that it is very necessary to concrete the said road even in the situation where the deplorable condition of the road through the forest area makes travel difficult. The meeting unanimously decided to request the Forest Department for permission to concrete the said road, which is very beneficial for the local residents.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO for Scrutiny and Recommendation
Project Name: Mulleria -Periyadka Road
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: The Secretary,Karadka Grama Panchayath, Mulleria Post,Kasaragod Dist, Kerala ,671543

Project Description: Proposed project is the construction of a sea pier adjacent to the dilapidated heritage sea pier of 300 m length at Alappuzha Beach, Alappuzha District, Kerala State. Length and width of the proposed sea pier is 300 m and 5 m respectively. The pier was initially proposed as a heritage structure to commemorate the golden era of the port and to promote tourism. Recognizing its strategic importance and potential, the Kerala Maritime Board later decided to repurpose the pier for broader functions. Now it will developed as an access point to passenger and cargo berthing jetty, aims to enhance maritime connectivity, trade operation and tourism potential.
Project Name: Alappuzha Heritage Project - Sea Pier
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The project is inspired from the existing sea pier of historical significance. Ensuring the preservation of  the heritage structure at its original site, the proposed sea pier is proposed to be constructed adjacent to  the existing sea pier and no alternative site has been considered.

Project Description: The major portion of Karavoor 11 KV feeder from 110 KV Substation Pathanapuram passes through thickly vegetated forest area. The line from Olappara to Kottakkayam passes through the reserve forest area where wild animals are roaming freely. It is common the Elephants uproot trees or break high girth tree branches and being thrown towards the line and interrupt power supply. There has also incident of falling trees and snapping live conductors, it may cause fatal accidents to wild animals. Moreover, it is very difficult and dangerous to locate and resolve Power outages that occurs at night and at the natural calamity. Therefore, this project is proposed to dismantling the existing overhead line from Olappara to Kottakkayam and there by laying the Underground Cable. This will reduce interruptions to minimum level and avoid accidents. This Project is being implemented through Central Aided Project (RDSS) scheme.
Last Visible Status: Pending at UA due to EDS by DFO
Organization Name: Kerala State Electricity Board Ltd. Piravanthoor Electrical Section
Project Name: Laying 5.6 KM 11KV XLPE Underground Cable from Olappara to Kottakkayam by replacing the existing Overhead line under KSEB Ltd. Electrical Section, Piravanthoor on RDSS scheme of Central Government
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: The project is the construction of a commercial complex at Thrissur with showroom, office, mall, convention center and hotel blocks. The construction of the project commenced in June 2015 upon receiving Environmental Clearance from SEIAA, Kerala with File No. 3/SEIAA/KL/374/2012, dated 21.05.2012. Construction of the project was stopped in January 2018 due to financial constraints. During the period June 2015 – January 2018, 72,634.73 Sq.m  BUA was constructed. The EC expired in May 2019.The proponent  has obtained CCR from MoEF&CC, Regional Office, Bengaluru. The proponent now intends to resume construction activities following the grant of Environmental Clearance (EC). No changes or revisions to the previously granted EC are proposed. As the Parivesh Portal does not provide an option for renewal of an expired EC, the application has been submitted under the category of a ‘New’ proposal.
Project Name: Construction of Commercial Complex Project by M/s Kenz Inn Commercial Complex Ltd at Ayyanthole Village, Thrissur Taluk, Thrissur District, Kerala State
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The land is under the possession of the applicant and construction of the structure already commenced in June 2015 with valid EC obtained in 2012 and expired on May 2019. Project Description: Beypore port is the second biggest port in Kerala after Cochin Port. Development of the Port of Beypore is proposed as part of the Sagarmala Project to improve the port facilities with an intention to attract more coastal traffic volume to the port. As per the traffic study undertaken, the present low level of cargo throughput at Beypore port is due to inadequate facilities at the port, more particularly the channel depth. Water depth available in the channels, turning circle and harbor basin is not adequate for the navigation of 6.0m draft vessels. The present proposal is for the development of two new coastal berths/wharfs, undertaking capital dredging for providing adequate depth in the channels, turning circle and harbor basin for navigation, maneuvering and berthing upto 10 m depth in three phases. For safe berthing, the tranquility condition near the existing berths at Beypore port, a protective structure of diaphragm wall is proposed at sea side.
EC Consultant: CSIR-National Institute for Interdisciplinary Science and Technology
Project Name: Development and modernization of coastal shipping and cargo handling at Beypore Port, Kozhikode, Kerala
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: The project is the construction of two-lane, two-way bridge across Kuttikol river (tributary of Kuppam river) in Cherukunnu village of Kannur taluk & Pattuvam village of Thaliparamba taluk of Kannur District, Kerala State The project is proposed by the Kerala Public Works Department (PWD) and the Kerala Road Fund Board (KRFB), the special purpose vehicle (SPV) for implementation of the proposed project. The proposed bridge has a length of 1,359.30 m and carriage way width of 7.50 m, comprising of 38 spans with varying span lengths including 2 spans of 35.95 m, 20 spans of 35.00 m, 12 spans of 34.40 m and 2 centre spans of 46.45 m length.The proposed bridge will have a horizontal clearance of 40.00 m at the central spans and a vertical clearance of 6.00 m above the Maximum Flood level (MFL).
Project Name: Proposed Construction of Kavinmunambu Bridge at Cherukunnu Village of Kannur Taluk & Pattuvam Village of Thaliparamba Taluk , Kannur District, Kerala State
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The selected location ensures seamless connectivity between Cherukunnu and Pattuvam panchayats  while minimizing impacts to sensitive ecosystem, land acquisition and avoiding disruption to existing  infrastructure

Project Description:
EC 135/2015 dated 15-01-2016 for an area of 4.685 ha was recommended for 10 years from the date of the original EC issued on 15.01.2016. Due to financial constraints, we are currently unable to undertake operations across the full extent of the sanctioned area. In light of this, we have obtained a Letter of Intent (No. 3814/M3/2019 dated 03-05-2019) specifically for a reduced area of 1.6067 hectares. Furthermore, the mining plan for this revised extent has also been duly approved by the competent authority (No. DOM/M-5038/2018 dated 23-10-2019). It is important to note that the proposed area of 1.6067 hectares lies entirely 
within the originally approved 4.685 hectares, as substantiated by the survey map No. 4676/18(1). Therefore, we kindly request SEIAA to consider modifying the EC accordingly—from 4.685 Ha to 1.6067 Ha—to align with our current operational and financial capacity

Project Description:
4G Saturation project is an on going project of Government of India to cover the uncovered villages/locations across the country to reduce the digital divide between urban and rural area. Provision of 4G mobile services for saturation coverage of 24,680 uncovered
villages across the country by installing 16,464 4G mobile towers at an
estimated cost of ₹17,664 Cr (CAPEX + OPEX for 5 years) (excluding taxes and
levies) to be funded by Universal Service Obligation Fund on cost plus with
10% administrative charges. Provision of coverage of 4936 additional villages as 20% extra villages for
rehabilitated villages, dropout from existing contracts due to RoW, whether or
other location conditions, new settlements, inability by TSPs to fulfil promised
coverage, withdrawal of services by existing operators, etc, at a cost of ₹3,496
Cr.The project will be executed by BSNL using Atmanirbhar Bharat’s 4G
technology stack and will be funded through Universal Services Obligation.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO for Scrutiny and Recommendation
